name: Double Down: Collision Point Earth & Pacific Protector
name_original: Double Down: Collision Point Earth & Pacific Protector
description:
//DESCRIPTION\\

--Collision Point Earth--

The Player must defend their power generators as long as possible by intercepting and destroying the plasmas from outer space with their anti-plasma photons.

Players use non-matching photon colors to destroy the outer space plasmas from stage to stage until all the power generators have been destroyed or the player makes it to the last stage.

5 game settings(easy, medium, hard, survive/training, and vintage) and 21 stages.

--Pacific Protector--

Pacific Protector is a fixed shooter type game that puts the player in control of the "Brizo Andreia", a submarine which is situated at the bottom of the screen.

At the beginning of each stage, the area is empty, but over time, the "Poluphorcydes" will make their way down to the player's area in groups of two or more and try to reach the bottom of the screen. If three make it to the bottom or time runs out, its game over.

During the stage, the player must fire upon the enemies and power ups while also completing the stage requirments to proceed to the next stage.

Notes:

Some GPU overlay software, like Riva Tuner Statistics Sever, may cause the game to hang on load. It maybe needed to create a profile for the game and set it to ignore/None or Vector 2D mode for rendering.

MINIMUM SYSTEM:

OS: Windows(32b or 64b) 7, 8, 8.1, or 10

Processor: Intel Dual Core at 1.8GHz/AMD Dual Core at 1.8GHz

Memory: 3.0 GB RAM

Graphics: DX9c with 256 MB

Hard Drive: 100 MB free

Input: Keyboard and Mouse
